instructions: From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings > More > Cellular networks > Access Point Names . If available, tap the T-Mobile US APN. If not available, tap the New APN icon. To reset your APN settings, tap the Menu icon with three dots, then tap Reset to default . Verify and update the following settings for the Data APN: Name: T-Mobile US APN: fast.t-mobile.com Proxy: <Not set> Port: <Not set> Username: <Not set> Password: <Not set> Server: <Not set> MMSC: http://mms.msg.eng.t-mobile.com/mms/wapenc MMS proxy: <Not set> MMS port: <Not set> MMS protocol: WAP 2.0 MCC: 310 MNC: 260 Authentication type: <Not set> APN type: default,supl,mms APN protocol: IPv6 APN roaming protocol: IPv4 Enable/disable APN: <greyed out unless there are multiple APN's> Bearer: Unspecified MVNO type: None MVNO value: <Not set> Tap the Menu icon with three dots, then tap Save . Tap the desired APN profile you want to use. The bullet point fills with color next to the APN profile.

From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings > More > Cellular networks > Network operators . Wait while the device populates a list of available networks. Tap the desired network you wish to register on.
From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings > More > Cellular networks > Preferred network types . Choose from the following options: LTE/WCDMA/GSM (Auto mode) WCDMA/GSM GSM only
From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings > More > Tap Airplane mode to turn on or off.
From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings > More > Cellular networks . Tap to turn Data Roaming on or off.
From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings > Data usage . Tap to turn Cellular data on or off.
